intro: Sphaeralcea ambigua subsp. rugosa, commonly known as the rough globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a rough texture. The plant produces showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Sphaeralcea ambigua subsp. rugosa is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes mallows and hibiscus.
